sn5kwl.question: The engine hydraulic pump (ENG 1 and ENG 2) switches are switch ON:

options.text: They de-energize the blocking valve to allow pump pressure to enter the system. The switches should remain ON at shutdown to prolong solenoid life.
They de-energize the blocking valve to allow pump pressure to enter the system. The switches should remain OFF at shutdown to prolong solenoid life.
They energize the blocking valve to allow pump pressure to enter the system. The switches should remain OFF at shutdown to prolong solenoid life.
They energize the blocking valve to allow pump pressure to enter the system. The switches should remain ON at shutdown to prolong solenoid life.

yortd.question: Hydraulic System A powers which hydraulic system components?

options.text: Landing gear, normal nose wheel steering and the power transfer unit (PTU)
Ground spoilers, normal nose wheel steering and the Landing Gear Transfer Unit
Ground spoilers, trailing edge flaps and the power transfer unit (PTU)
Alternate nose wheel steering, Alternate brakes and ground spoilers

c4kwf.question: Which statement is true regarding thrust reverser operation with a failure of hydraulic System A?

options.text: The No.1 thrust reverser will automatically operate using the Standby System.
The No.1 thrust reverser will operate normally from System B via the PTU.
The No.1 thrust reverser will operate using the Standby System if the Standby System has been manually or automatically activated.
The No.1 thrust reverser will be inoperative.

ocgmh.question: If a leak develops in the hydraulic System A reservoir, which associated pump(s) will have hydraulic fluid available from below the standpipe?

options.text: Both the the engine driven pump (EDP) and the AC electric motor-driven pump
Neither pump
The AC electric motor-driven pump
The engine driven pump

rp2fm.question: Alternate nose wheel steering (NWS) is powered by system A, and normal NWS is powered by system B.

qzgymj.question: Hydraulic System A powers which hydraulic system components?

options.text: Ground spoilers, trailing edge flaps and the power transfer unit (PTU)
Alternate nose wheel steering, Alternate brakes and ground spoilers
Alternate nose wheel steering, Alternate brakes and ground spoilers
None of the other answers are correct

zuxam.question: What is the maximum hydraulic system pressure.

b2cxh.question: The purpose of the Power Transfer Unit (PTU) is to supply system A with the volume of hydraulic fluid from system B to raise the landing gear at the normal rate when system A Engine Driven Pump volume is lost.

iv7x9.question: Which systems are powered by the hydraulic system?

options.text: Flight controls, autothrottles, wheel brakes, leading and trailing edge flaps, leading edge slats, nose wheel steering, landing gear, thrust reversers.
Yaw damper, autopilot and autothrottle, flight controls, brakes, landing gear, trailing edge flaps and slats, nose wheel steering, tiller, power transfer unit, landing gear transfer unit.
Flight controls, Anti-skid, trailing edge flaps and slats, nose wheel steering, landing gear, thrust reversers, autopilots.
Flight controls, wheel brakes, leading and trailing edge flaps, leading edge slats, nose wheel steering, landing gear, thrust reversers, autopilots.

8f0haj.question: If hydraulic system A develops a leak the engine driven pump (EDP) in system A is starved of oil before the electrical motor driven pump.  If system B develops a leak, the electrical motor driven pump in system B is the first to be starved of oil?

sz22b.question: The electric motor driven hydraulic pumps are cooled and lubricated by hydraulic oil passing through them - this oil is then cooled by passing through a fuel cooled oil cooler located in each main tank.  What quantity of fuel must there be in each main tank to operate the electric driven pumps on the ground?

options.text: 726 kg
363 kg
760 kg
453 kg

ja7n6.question: How is hydraulic oil pressure stopped from entering the system when the Engine Driven Pumps (EDPs) are switched to OFF?

options.text: A blocking valve in the pump is energised allowing it to close and stop pressure entering the system.
A blocking valve in the pump is de-energised allowing it to close and stop pressure entering the system.
The EDPs are mechanically disengaged from the engine external gearbox by means of a Sprag clutch.
The EDPs are mechanically disengaged from the engine external gearbox by means of a electronic clutch.

explanation:
**STBY RUD** - activates standby hydraulic system pump and opens standby rudder
shutoff valve to pressurize standby rudder power control unit.

- **OFF** - closes flight control shutoff valve isolating ailerons, elevators and rudder
from associated hydraulic system pressure.
- **ON** (guarded position) - normal operating position.

in83r.question: Moving the STBY RUD switch to ON activates the standby pump and opens the standby rudder shutoff valve to pressurise the standby power control unit.
in83r.explanation: Switching to **OFF** triggers the changes described!

in83q.question: Moving the STBY RUD switch to OFF activates the standby pump and opens the standby rudder shutoff valve to pressurise the standby power control unit.

tkjgd.question: What is the effect on the Standby Hydraulic System, if there is a leak in system B?

options.text: No effect as the standby system is supplied from system A.
The standby system will decrease but only a limited amount due to the standpipe in system B reservoir.
No effect as the standby system has its own accumulator.
The level in the standby system will also decrease as it is linked to system B.

c0qw7.question: While airborne and with flaps retracted, if hydraulic System A or System B loose pressure does the Standby hydraulic system automatically activate?

options.text: Yes, but only if both System A and System B loose pressure.
No, automatic activation only occurs if either System A or System B loose pressure and flaps are extended.
No, automatic activation only occurs if both System A and System B loose pressure and flaps are extended.
Yes, failure of either System A or System B will cause automatic activation of the Standby hydraulic system.

527ux.question: What effect will a leak in system B downstream of the EDP have on the Power Transfer Unit (PTU)?

options.text: It will function as normal as it is part of the standby system and powered by system A oil pressure.
A leak in system B has no effect as the PTU only uses oil from system A to operate.
It will cease to function as it requires oil from system B to operate.
It will continue to function if required due to oil in the system B reservoir below the standpipe level.

egak4.question: With a loss of system B pressure the standby system can be used to extend the leading and trailing edge devices, the leading edge devices cannot be retracted again once extended by the standby system, but the trailing edge flaps can be retracted by electric motors using the ALTERNATE FLAPS position switch, but no asymmetry or skew protection is then provided.

oubsui.question: Which conditions must exist when airborne for the landing gear transfer unit to operate?

options.text: No. 1 engine RPM drops below a limit value, landing gear lever is positioned up, any landing gear is not up and locked
No. 1 engine RPM drops below a limit value, landing gear lever is positioned up, either main landing gear is not up and locked
No. 1 engine driven pump (EDP) fails, landing gear lever is positioned up, either main landing gear is not up and locked
No. 1 engine driven pump (EDP) pressure below limits, landing gear lever is positioned up, any main landing gear is not up and locked

7os8g.question: The Power Transfer Unit (PTU) supplies pressure to which flight controls if the System B Engine Driven Pump (EDP) pressure drops below limits?

options.text: Trailing Edge (TE) flaps and Leading Edge (LE) flaps
Trailing Edge (TE) flaps
The Autoslat system and all leading edge devices
The landing gear

s8j1ff.question: Which statement is true regarding Hydraulic System A failure? The Standby hydraulic system, powered by a single electric-motor driven pump, has been manually activated.

options.text: Ground spoiler are inoperative, increasing landing distance. Half of the flight spoilers on each wing are inoperative, reducing roll rate. Engine 1 thrust reverser will deploy and retract at a slower rate and some asymmetry can be anticipated during thrust reverser deployment.

Ground spoiler are inoperative, increasing landing distance. Half of the flight spoilers on each wing are inop, reducing roll rate. Both thrust reversers are powered by the Standby system to avoid asymmetry during thrust reverser deployment.

Ground spoiler are inoperative, increasing landing distance. Half of the flight spoilers on each wing are powered by the Standby hydraulic system. Engine 1 thrust reverser will deploy and retract at a slower rate and some asymmetry can be anticipated during thrust reverser deployment.

Ground spoilers are powered by the Standby system and are operative. Half of the flight spoilers on each wing are inoperative, reducing roll rate. Engine 1 thrust reverser will deploy and retract at a slower rate and some asymmetry can be anticipated during thrust reverser deployment.

m1sd1f.question: The hydraulic system quantity is displayed on the lower DU by digital indication from 0 to 100%.
